quest.name: Where the Streets Are Paved with Koban
journal: Hancock would like very much to continue talking.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Even the aetherytes look different here...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I note that our would-be host has elected to dress in the local fashion.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> I say, what is that I smell wafting from yonder teahouse? Could it be─ Yes, could it just possibly be the scent of whispered secrets waiting to be overheard?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I do not like the cut of that man's jib. Not one bit.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Beautiful though it may be, we cannot spend all day staring at the aetheryte.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Come, come, let us move along. The markets are next!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: No sign of Gosetsu or Yugiri here. Not that I expected to stumble across them just like that. Though it would have been nice...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
Just look at all these garish designs... Not fond of subtlety, are they.
Hm, is that a theater over there?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Be still my heart!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, well. I would expect no less of a bustling port...

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: We have arrived at the largest shopping district in Kugane: Kogane Dori!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: "Kugane,“ as you are doubtless unaware, is an ancient Hingan word for gold. So, in this prosperous port where golden fortunes are made, lesser fortunes, or ”kogane,“ are earned by the local merchants. It's all quite logical once you learn the language.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Heh heh heh... Now you're beginning to speak my language...

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Oho! A kindred spirit! What a pleasure it is to meet a young lady who appreciates the value of hard-won coin!

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Hancock of the East Aldenard Trading Company. You are with clients today?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Why, if it isn't Master Keiten! Pray allow me to introduce to you my esteemed guests, but recently come from distant Eorzea.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: This kind and generous soul supervises all transactions here in Kogane Dori.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: Your sincerity is ever appreciated. As he says, I am Keiten of the Hakuuchi clan, and it is my honor to serve as overseer of these markets.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: As we receive many foreign visitors in Kugane, we accept all manner of currencies. Rest assured, your Eorzean gil are welcome here. I invite you to peruse our wares at your leisure.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Arms, armor, foodstuffs, potables─here you will find all of them and more.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Where to next, I wonder?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Hmm... We're actually quite far from the docks now, aren't we. This place is bigger than I thought.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Don't think I haven't memorized every detail of that street! There's at least half a dozen shops that will soon be enjoying my custom!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmm...the district up ahead has a different air about it.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: If we may pause here for a moment...

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: This road leads to the Ijin-gai: the district in which “ijin”─or foreigners─are permitted to reside.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Would this also be where the foreign embassies are found─including that of a certain empire?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Precisely. So you see, it would not be at all unusual to cross paths with one of our Garlean cousins here. With this in mind, I would encourage you to choose your words carefully. We would not want any physical altercations, after all, such spats being strictly forbidden!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: The Sekiseigumi punish breaches of the peace quite severely. I have seen foreigners permanently exiled for a single violation─though, to be fair, this is not common. More often than not, they are executed on the spot.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: What, cut down then and there!? You're joking, right?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Would that I were, but alas, these samurai are a humorless lot.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Why, I recall one instance when a foreign merchant in his cups dared lay hands upon a Hingan aristocrat in front of a Sekiseigumi. The samurai cut him in half with a single stroke.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Ugh, I don't even want to think about that...

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: So, as you see, it would behoove you to behave. Failing that, we may be forced to “part ways” with one another─or you with yourselves, in the manner of the late Teledji Adeledji!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: ...Oh, how I amuse myself. But we must carry on! I have yet to show you the Garlean Consulate!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So that building's full of Garleans...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Some might call it unwise to loiter outside the gates of a hostile empire's consulate.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Danger! Excitement! Intrigue! Oh, my!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Compared to the Hingan architecture, this seems drab and uninspired. Or mayhap I have simply had my fill of Garlean aesthetics, such as they are.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: This, as you may have surmised, is the consulate of you-know-who. Mark the guards at the gate─are their uniforms not different from those you have seen in the West?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Were you to travel far and wide, you would find that many such variations exist, often inspired by local designs. All of which goes to show that even a massive empire seeking to rule all of creation is not without its artisans!

dialogue.name: EATCASSISTANT
dialogue.text: Greetings, misssir, and welcome to the Kugane branch offices of the East Aldenard Trading Company. Do you have an appointment?

obj.n: By the Grace of Lord Lolorito
